wikipedia_page.main: Margaret Beda Nicholson (née Larminie; 30 January 1924 – 17 November 2012), known professionally as Margaret Yorke, was an English crime fiction writer.

response: *St Mark's College – The Pursuit of Love by Nancy Mitford; Patrick Grant crime novels by Margaret Yorke; The Stars' Tennis Balls by Stephen Fry
*Margaret Yorke (pseudonym of Margaret Beda Nicholson; 1924–2012), British author

Kinn Hamilton McIntosh  (born 20 June 1930), known professionally as Catherine Aird, is an English novelist. She is the author of more than twenty crime fiction novels and several collections of short stories. Her witty, literate, and deftly plotted novels straddle the "cozy" and "police procedural" genres and are somewhat similar in flavour to those of Martha Grimes, Caroline Graham, M C Beaton, Margaret Yorke, and Pauline Bell. She is a recipient of the Cartier Diamond Dagger award.
* 1982 – Margaret Yorke, The Scent of Fear, (UK, 1980)
*Margaret Yorke (1924–2012), crime writer, winner of the Crime Writers' Association Cartier Diamond Dagger Award, 1999
* 17 November – Margaret Yorke, 88, crime fiction writer.
*Margaret Yorke, 88, British crime fiction writer.In Memoriam: Margaret Yorke
